intro: Hieracium diremtum, commonly known as the divided hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium diremtum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
